titleStmt.title: Vox populi, or Newes from Spayne translated according to the Spanish coppie ; which may serve to forwarn both England and the Vnited Provinces how farre to trust to Spanish pretences.
titleStmt.author: Scott, Thomas.

titleStmt.title: Vox populi, or Newes from Spayne translated according to the Spanish coppie ; which may serve to forwarn both England and the Vnited Provinces how farre to trust to Spanish pretences.
titleStmt.author: Scott, Thomas.

notesStmt.note: Attributed to Scott by NUC pre-1956 imprints and STC (2nd ed.)
Place of publication suggested by STC (2nd ed.).
In title: "how farre to \"; A3r last line: "Cōmander".
Contains fictitious account of Count Gondomar's reception by the council of state on his return to Madrid in 1618--Dict. of Nat. Biog.
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library and Harvard University. Library.

person.persName: Gondomar, Diego Sarmiento de Acu~na, Conde de,
